course_title: Special Topics with Laboratory: Plant-Insect-Microbe Interact.
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 1Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Permission of instructor is required.  Course Description:  Plants often produce defensive chemicals in response to insect herbivores.  In turn, insects harbor microbial symbionts that can detoxify these compounds.  In this lab course, students will work in research teams to explore plant-insect-microbe interactions in the bean beetle model system.  Students will use research techniques from ecology, microbiology, molecular biology, and bioinformatics.  In addition, students will develop skills in experimental design, data analysis, and science communication)
Prerequisites:  Biology 142 + 142L and permission of instructor.  Contact Dr. Beck at cbeck@emory.edu for permission.  Students must also register for a Biology 386-3 Laboratory, section 4 or 5.
course_description: Study of particular subjects pertaining to biology with laboratory or field experiences.  May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
sections: Class Nbr: 2686, Section #: 3, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: F 9:40-10:55a, Instructor: Beck/Zelaya, Status: Open
